DOC.brief_summary: 122 people over 70 who were admitted to hospital were enrolled to the study. Half got .5 mg a night of melatonin, half got a placebo.
DOC.brief_title: Melatonin Supplementation for Delirium Prevention in Acutely Hospitalized Elderly
DOC.criteria: Age over 65 admitted through the emergency department to an internal medicine service in London, Ontario, Canada. Life expectancy less than 24 hours, Unable to communicate in English, Unable to take oral medications, Intracranial bleed or known seizure disorder, Markedly sub or supratherapeutic INR while on warfarin, OR A known allergy to study tablet ingredients.
